p.value: Materials are open without restrictions.
The Marcelo DeMoura Papers were acquired from Marcelo DeMoura by the Fales Library in 2001. The accession number associated with this gift is 2001.112

item.value: Series III: Drafts and Story Boards

p.value: Materials are divided into three series, and arranged alphabetically by film title within each series.

Marcelo DeMoura, animator and collector of animation, has worked in the animation departments of such films as Thumbelina (1994), The Iron Giant (1999), and Ice Age (2002). He has also directed animated programs in his native Brazil.

extent.value: In 1 record carton, 1 document case, 1 oversize box.

abstract.value: Marcelo DeMoura is an animation artist and collector of animation artworks. The Marcelo DeMoura Papers contain original drawings and animation cels, as well as copies of additional drawings and Disney movie drafts.

physloc.value: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

Materials are divided by format into two Subseries (Drawings and Animation cels), and arranged alphabetically by title within each subseries.

This series contains all of the original artworks in the archive. Subseries A features a particularly strong collection of drawings from The Secret of Nimh (1982). Strengths of Subseries B include animation cels from Thumbelina (1994). Some of the animation cels are signed by Don Bluth (see notes below item descriptions).

unittitle.value: Banjo and the Woodpile Cat
The Pebble and the Penguin

p.value: Materials are arranged alphabetically by title.
Series II contains photocopies of individual scenes from various animated films. Strengths of this series include drawings from An American Tail (1986).

unittitle.value: Mickey and the Beanstalk draft
The Rescuers Down Under draft
The Sword in the Stone draft
Series III: Drafts and Story Boards

p.value: This series contains story boards from Rocket Power (1999), a television series on which DeMoura served as story artist, as well as script drafts of a number of Disney films, including Dumbo (1941) and Alice in Wonderland (1951).
Materials are arranged alphabetically by title.

unittitle.value: Disney production Photostats of Model Sheets

p.value: Contains photostats from: Pluto's Fledgling (1941), So Dear to My Heart (1946), Primitive Pluto (1947), "Lambert Wolf" (1953), and Moby Duck (1966).
Identification of item, date (if known); Marcelo DeMoura Papers; MSS 112; box number; folder number, Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Collection processed by Nicholas Martin in 2010.
John Canemaker Animation Collection (MSS 040)

The bulk of the Marcelo DeMoura Papers consists of original artworks and photocopied animation drawings that span a date range from 1982-1999. The collection also contains photostats of model sheets, drafts, and scripts from Disney films dating back to 1941. A large quantity of the original artworks, some of which feature the artist's signature, were drawn by noted animator and director Don Bluth.

Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Sep 2010
